articles.headline: Sold on eBay, Shipped by Amazon.com
articles.snippet: Amazon.com is expanding a program to allow independent sellers — even vendors who sell through eBay — to use its shipping services.
articles.abstract: Amazon.com is expanding a program to allow independent sellers — even vendors who sell through eBay — to use its shipping services.
articles.lead_paragraph: Your next eBay purchase could arrive at your door in a brown Amazon.com box.

articles.headline: For Shareholders, a Ticket Into an $8 Billion Deal
articles.snippet: The proposed buyout of Harman has an unusual feature, known as a stub, that lets shareholders keep a stake in newly private company.
articles.abstract: The proposed buyout of Harman has an unusual feature, known as a stub, that lets shareholders keep a stake in newly private company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Private equity has done much bigger deals in the last two years. But the $8 billion buyout for Harman International Industries, the maker of JBL speakers and Harman Kardon home theater systems, may prove the most groundbreaking.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Jeremy W. Peters

articles.headline: Why Won’t Companies Invest More?
articles.snippet: The reality is that companies are quite happy spending their profits — and in many cases, much more — on buying back their stock.
articles.abstract: The reality is that companies are quite happy spending their profits — and in many cases, much more — on buying back their stock.
articles.lead_paragraph: To the Federal Reserve, it is puzzling that business investment is not stronger. To business executives, it is only natural. They see relatively few opportunities for investment, and ample reason to send cash to shareholders.

articles.headline: Ford Cut Loss in 1st Quarter; U.S. Sales Fell
articles.snippet: Ford executives said that a smaller loss in the first quarter was proof that their corporate overhaul was working.
articles.abstract: Ford executives said that a smaller loss in the first quarter was proof that their corporate overhaul was working.
articles.lead_paragraph: DEARBORN, Mich., April 26 — Ford Motor Company executives said Thursday that a smaller loss in the first quarter was proof that their corporate overhaul was working.
articles.byline: By Micheline Maynard and Nick Bunkley

articles.headline: Putin to Suspend Pact With NATO
articles.snippet: The announcement underscored the Kremlin’s anger at the U.S.  for proposing a new missile defense system.
articles.abstract: The announcement underscored the Kremlin’s anger at the U.S.  for proposing a new missile defense system.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, April 26 — President Vladimir V. Putin said Thursday that Russia would suspend its compliance with a treaty on conventional arms in Europe that was forged at the end of the cold war, opening a fresh and intense dispute in the souring relations between NATO and the Kremlin.
articles.byline: By C. J. Chivers and Mark Landler

articles.headline: A ‘First Spouse’ in France? Not Any Time Soon
articles.snippet: Both French presidential candidates, Nicolas Sarkozy and Ségolène Royal, are members of unconventional couples.
articles.abstract: Both French presidential candidates, Nicolas Sarkozy and Ségolène Royal, are members of unconventional couples.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS, April 26 — No matter who wins the presidency of France on May 6, life in the grand, presidential Élysée Palace is destined to change.

articles.headline: Dean at M.I.T. Resigns, Ending a 28-Year Lie
articles.snippet: The dean of admissions at M.I.T. admitted that she had lied about having an undergraduate degree.
articles.abstract: The dean of admissions at M.I.T. admitted that she had lied about having an undergraduate degree.
articles.lead_paragraph: Marilee Jones, the dean of admissions at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, became well known for urging stressed-out students competing for elite colleges to calm down and stop trying to be perfect. Yesterday she admitted that she had fabricated her own educational credentials, and resigned after nearly three decades at M.I.T. Officials of the institute said she did not have even an undergraduate degree.

articles.headline: The Pressure of Great Expectations
articles.snippet: Joseph R. Perella’s new investment bank has a big budget and a star cast but is still waiting for a big-time deal.
articles.abstract: Joseph R. Perella’s new investment bank has a big budget and a star cast but is still waiting for a big-time deal.
articles.lead_paragraph: Some of the most successful investment banking start-ups have begun with just a handful of bankers, some borrowed office space and a secretary.

articles.headline: Echoes of Terror Case Haunt California Pakistanis
articles.snippet: The Pakistani community in Lodi, Calif., was traumatized after the arrest of a father and son accused of terrorism.
articles.abstract: The Pakistani community in Lodi, Calif., was traumatized after the arrest of a father and son accused of terrorism.
articles.lead_paragraph: LODI, Calif., April 24 — Khalid Farooq has shunned the low-slung yellow bungalow that serves as the Pakistani community’s mosque here for nearly two years, ever since a father and son who worshiped there were arrested on suspicion of being foot soldiers for Al Qaeda.
